intro: Inula limonella, commonly known as the yellow fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
